intro: Nemophila sepulta var. densa, commonly known as the dense blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, sky-blue flowers with a white eye, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its overall delicate appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
